activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick E. Bass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Condition of Probation on count 1 and 2:

Participate and successfully complete Richland County Drug Treatment Court. 

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Costs waived.

Credit in the event of revocation: 112 days
Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation today

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick E. Bass

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing 10/12/22
Participant and team present. Discussion. Compliance noted.

2:04 PM Defendant Patrick E. Bass in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Yang in court for Patrick E. Bass.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Court speaks about the presentence investigation. 

Attorney Harper asks that on count 1 and 2 be for 4 years of probation with the condition: "participate and successfully complete treatment court". Count 3 that state would be asking for costs only.  Attorney Harper heard.

Attorney Yang asks for 2 years probation instead of 4 years. Instead of costs on count 3; Attorney Yang asks for 30 days and states that there is 120 days credit. 


Court orders on count 1 & 2

Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 3 years.

Conditions:

Participate and successfully complete Richland County Drug Treatment Court. 

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Costs waived.

Credit in the event of revocation: 112 days
Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation today


Court order on count 3; costs only.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: (filed by counsel in advance of today's hearing)
Sentencing hearing on October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:59 PM Defendant Patrick E. Bass in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Yang in court for Patrick E. Bass.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Counsel inform the Court that the parties have a plea agreement but are not in agreement on the sentencing recommendation; Def wishes to enter his pleas today; State is asking for PSI; Defense will be asking for bond modification if sentencing does not occur today. Per the agreement, Def is pleading to all three charges in 22CF77; agreement calls for 22CF76 to be dismissed. 

In 22CF77, Court review pleas questionnaire/waiver with the Def. Def pleads guilty to the three counts in 22CF77. 

Atty. Yang - Defense argues for sentencing to allow for treatment court. DA Harper - State argues for PSI prior to sentencing. Court orders PSI. Sentencing set for 10/12 at 2 p.m. PSI due 10/5. Defense may also request an alternate PSI from SPD. If they do, Court orders that PSI to be due 10/5 as well.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

22CF76 DRI.
From Treatment Court Coordinator; Determination of Eligibility

3:02 PM 22CF76/22CF77 -Defendant Patrick E. Bass appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Yang appeared by video for Patrick E. Bass.  Attorney Yang has received the information and waives the formal reading. Max penalties stated. Attorney Yang stands mute on all charges for his client. Court advices the clerk to enter a NG plea. Attorney Yang asks for another status. Court sets theses cases on the trial calendar. PB has applied for drug court. Attorney Harper states that this will be a jointer and ask for two day for trial. Attorney Yang speaks about the jointer case.

Arraignment on July 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:24 AM 10:23 AM 22CF76/22CF77 - Defendant Patrick E. Bass in court, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Yang in court for Patrick E. Bass. PB has received the criminal complaint. Attorney Yang waives the formal reading. Max penalties stated. Attorney Yang waives the preliminary hearing. 

Attorney Yang speaks about bond modification in 22CF77 and request a $200 cash bond. Attorney Harper object to the bond modification in 22CF77. Court denies bond modification.

records.addlTxt: to Modify Bond
Initial appearance on July 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter requesting earlier time for 7/13 hearing
Initial appearance on July 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Bail Bond Review
Attorney Harper appears for the state. Attorney Yang appears by Zoom. Defendant appears in the courtroom.
Court speaks about the prior hearings in this case. Attorney Harper speaks about the proposed charges. Attorney Harper comments about bond and request an increase to $1,000 cash bond. Defendant history was stated by Attorney Harper. Attorney Yang comments about the purpose of bond and request a signature bond. 

Court will keep the bond at $400 cash bond. If a complaint isn't filed by bond by tomorrow (07/01/22) then the defendant will be released.

Defendant updates the address: 513 Jordan Way, Spring Green, WI
State's objection to Reducing the Defendant's $400 Cash Bond
To Modify Bond

Attorney Harper appears for the state. Attorney Erickson appears for the defendant. PB appears in person; in custody. Attorney Harpers asks for a $1500 cash bond and notes that PB is on a probation hold. Attorney Harper speaks about the open cases. Attorney Erickson speaks about the probation hold and asks for a signature bond. Court orders $400 cash bond. Initial set for 07/13/22 at 2:30
